snippet: The agreement would let businesses like Google and Facebook continue to move personal data across the Atlantic, but European privacy officials may balk.
abstract: European Union officials reach agreement with United States that will allow companies to continue moving customers' digital data back and forth between continents; deal is result of months of often tense negotiations that pitted individuals' privacy concerns against those of national security.
lead_paragraph: The agreement would let businesses like Google and Facebook continue to move personal data across the Atlantic, but European privacy officials may balk.

headline.main: U.S. and Europe in ‘Safe Harbor’ Data Deal, but Legal Fight May Await
headline.print_headline: Deal Struck to Balance U.S.-Europe Data Fears
